caption: Best Pizza in all of my 50 years. Creative, unique. Perfect. The service is refreshing and absolutely I will be returning.
Great 🤤🤤

Amazing restaurant with the family owned feel.  Tried their Italian wedding soup. I don't like soup but the person I was with ordered it. After trying one bite I had to get my own bowl.  Also their calzones are amazing and worth the try.

Gino, Caesar and Denzel were amazing!!!! I needed a quick margarita pizza to go and Dino and Caesar were the men for the job. They moved fast and most importantly the place was very clean even Dino cleaning after each touch point he encountered with his dish wear. Very chill friendly atmosphere.

Bar none and by far the best gluten free pizza I’ve ever experienced. The crust reminded me of the (not gluten free( napoletano style pizzas I enjoyed during the 4 summers I lived in Italy. Authentic with high quality ingredients. I can’t wait to return. My husband enjoyed a regular pizza and raved. My cousin ordered the calzone and said it was one of the best she has ever tasted. Atmosphere: excellent. The staff are friendly and seem to genuinely 1) be happy to see you and 2) want to make your visit so pleasant and perfect. If you are not hungry, stop in for house made tiramisu or espresso. Excellent.  Non ho MAI mangiato una pizza senza glutine così buona!!!! Complimenti allo chef / pizzaiolo Gino!!!
Excellent staff
I love the pizza in this place, everything is fresh and the pizza is baked in a wood oven, which gives a unique flavor to their pizzas.
BEST pizza in Chicago. If I could give a 10 star I would. It's local and organic. Melt in your mouth pizza with great flavor👌 The owners/servers are so sweet as well. You won't be disappointed.

Me and my wife live across the street, been meaning to come here but because of Covid we kept pushing it back. We finally came here on last Sunday night, the food was incredible. We ordered the involtini golfo di napoli to start and split the red pasta and burratina. The cheese is incredible, one of the best mozzarella we’ve had. We will be back!
Great cheese! And the pizzas are half off on Tuesdays
Amazing paninis, fresh food and great service!
Absolute must eat at while in chicago!
COVID protocols marginally in place.
Fresh tasting pizza and pasta, with cheese made from their own organic dairy farm. Friendly staff, inside and outside dining.
I liked the cheese.
One of my fav places to go!The pizza is great!Also the service is good.
Terrific burrata but a bit pricey.
Excellent food, excellent service (Chicago is know for terrible service).
This is a great restaurant. It is an authentic Italian experience, highly recommended!
Great food and excellent service.

We just discovered this place about a month ago. Italian family own, wonderful food, a real italian experience. (Lived in Italy for years, so i can comfortably say that;) 4 cheese truffle pizza is to die for. When you eat the cheese. Literally melts in your mouth and smell the milk. Wonderful service. Definetly must go place.

First time here and was Very disappointed. I ordered red pasta and the sauce was watered down, pasta under cooked and blended. Also ordered a margarita pizza and it was very white lacking sauce. I asked a server for some extra marinara sauce and she brought me some ice cold. Not authentic Italian at all...
GOOD CONCEPT, BUT Disappointing.  Could be Covid related but with only a handful of customers it wasnt care. Food cold
Food was just okay.   We had a group of people and split salads, calzones and pizza.   It was decent.
Too greasy too thin raspberry tea suckes wanted unsweetened ice tea no stars

Never thought of going in because outside it appears to be a quickie pizza slice place...but no! As one who has a second home in Italy and is finicky about authentic Italian cuisine this is Napoli on a Chicago street corner 1/2 block off Michigan. Organic cheeses made locally, a menu stacked with pizza, pasta and salad options and friendly atmosphere and service.  We will make it a regular for coffee, dessert and dinner.  Bravissimo!!
Outdoor seating, really nice location. Extremely polite and proffessional service. Pizza super delicious!
One of our favorite restaurants. Amazing food and service every time.

We love the Motzerella store! We tell everyone about it because it's that great. It's owned by Italians and it truly shows in the authenticity of everything they do. The pizza is AMAZING, we think the best in city (we have been everywhere). They also have gluten free  pizza which is great for me as I have a gluten allergy. We have only had pizza but i look forward to trying other items on their menu. They make their own cheeses and have a dairy farm. The quality of ingredients is very apparent. They have a beautiful wine list, great cocktails and the setting is very inviting. We love to sit on the patio, its fun being downtown but just set slightly off of Michigan ave. They are always friendly and remember us. Go visit this place, its amazing!
Great pizza of course!!!
Amazing pizza & service! Would highly recommend!

Eating at the restaurant was good, service too, tho I also ordered a mozzarella cheese ball to go and shared my concern of how fresh the mozzarella would be and was assured it was super fresh.  I got home and cut the cheeseball in two and it appeared a slight yellowish color in the middle, so, I tossed it.  On a second visit and purchase it still didn't seem right.  It was the end of the day on both occasions if that makes a difference. I'm hoping someone can confirm how it should appear once cut in two. The better mozzarellas are almost fluid like inside and white.
EVERYTHING was delicious!  The food was farm fresh and and the pizza crust was amazing. We are looking forward to our next meal there! Ready to tey more. The staff was also a delight!
Fantastic service! The burrata appetizer and Margherita pizza were amazing- highly recommend!

One of the best places to have pizza in downtown. I ordered a veggie and cheese margerita pizza. I took a take-away so I placed the order and then was waiting in the seating area for my order to be ready. Staff was very courteous and helpful.  It didn't take much time for my order to be ready. Along with the order I was given all the accompaniment i.e chilli flakes, origami ans well as cheese. They have seating space on upper floors as well which should accomodate approx 100 people at once.
Comfortable. Fresh tasty food.  Good Happy Hour!  Attentive service.  Creamy mozzarella.
Nice
Delightful place to eat the real pizza. The waiter was so regardful with us. A bit expensive but really worth it.
I loved it there. It's a small cozy place. The staff was very friendly and polite, also very attentive.
Good

Service was strong-handed and food was unimpressive. Surprisingly disappointing for this price point and in this neighborhood. They must be surviving on disoriented tourist traffic.  With so many great options for pizza and Italian within walking distance, DONT waste any time or $ here.
What a wondeful find.  Great service, food and atmosphere.  Like a little slice of Europe in the heart of Chicago.
Outstanding

In my opinion you can find one of the best pizza in Chicago... mozzarella cheese was absolutely fresh and the tomato sauce and dough were perfect..but in my opinion could be better the service, the relationship with their customers... lack of personality
Food is tasty and fresh--service is good too.  Just a little pricey, but it is on Mag Mile so it's to be expected.

Stumbled upon this place while window shopping the Mag Mile.  Thought it was a cheese store but it's also a restaurant! A very good one too. Right across from the Ghirardelli, this place is a gemstone of a find! Started with the burrata sliders and had the calzone napoli for lunch.  Portion size for the calzone is excellent for two mildly hungry people or one starving individual lol I enjoyed every bite.  The sliders were memorable too; cold creamy burrata complemented with flavorful peppers made this the best thing I've had in a while.   Highly recommend pairing with an espresso macchiato for dessert <3

The pizza was undercooked, the pasta tasted like plastic and the bread was stale. I am Italian and I was in the city for work and I heard it was like Naples in Chicago but it’s definitely not. Highly disappointed, no wonder why it was empty on a Saturday night
This restaurant is so authentic! Amazing service and even better food.
Good. Pretty expensive. Server seemed a bit off that day.
Friendly service and great food. Joseph H. is a great server

We had a wonderful experience at the Mozzarella Store! Our wood fired margarita pizza and salad were fresh and delicious, and the paninis are also very good. The nutella croissant is a must–it was unbelievably delicious and made from scratch, and the cappuccinos were divine.The staff is very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Can't wait to go back!

ABSOLUTELY A. M. A. Z. I. N. G. Food service and speed. Ordered during a busy time and for our food in under 3minutes and the cheese.. oooh the cheese is amazing behind belif great atmosphere and right by the historic water tower! 10/5 stars 100% would go again sadly just visiting town for a few days
Great ambiance and incredible cheese. Family owned (from Italy too) they even own the farm! True farm to table. Fantastic!

Great place to eat and hang out with friends. Amazing appetizers, pizza and coffee..real Italian food, like it’s supposed to taste and look. Even the furniture is Italian. Great ambient - whoever decorated this place deserves a medal. Service was top notch. I’ll definitely visit this place more often. 10/10.
Loved the food! Mamma Mia!
Excellent food and service. Highly recommend this place for the authentic taste.
Great
Pizza crust was very soggy, still a tasty pizza though.

(Translated by Google) The owner prepares his own cheese, which is delicious, the basil with which they prepare food is very fragrant. The pizzas are cooked to the wood and accompanied with a good beer becomes a pleasant experience of flavor.  (Original) El dueño prepara su propio queso, el cual es delicioso,  la albahaca con la que preparan los alimentos es muy perfumada. Las pizzas son cocinadas a la leña y acompañadas con una buena cerveza se convierte en una grata experiencia de sabor.
Pizza is so disappointing.

Good food, very good service. We'd made reservations online since it was our anniversary, and they brought out two free glasses of champagne! Very nice gesture, even though I don't drink alcohol.  But, my wife enjoyed both glasses, said it was delicious.
Very fresh food with fine ingredients A bit pricey but worth it for the quality. Casual setting
LOVE THE PEOPLE especially our server Joey! The pizza was phenomenal! Recommended this place to everyone
Pizza is AMAZING!!  Also the service is excellent, highly recommend it!
Really disappointing going in here.  Staff was not friendly or helpful.
Terrible.  They served us ROTTEN burrata, twice.  Then they left it on the bill, that we didn't see until they'd already run the credit card.
Friendly staff with great Prosecco
Cozy genuine place to dine in or buy ingredients for a delicious dinner at home. Homemade mozzarella made fresh daily in house. Fresh pastry. Burrata, ricotta and Mozzarella to go.
Excellent Margherita pizza, inventive salads and appetizers. Perfect for a light lunch. Love the relaxed abd friendly vibe. Support this family-run place!
Really enjoyed our meal here! The vegeteriana pizza was amazing and the staff was really friendly and accommodating.  Will be back to eat here soon :)

I had the calabrese panini which was wonderful! The calzone could've used more salt- we just added it ourselves. And the salad I had (waitress' recommendation of the closest thing to a house salad) was superb! Thank you for a great experience.
Nepolitian style Pizzas made with fresh ingredients. Good appetizers.

What a phenomenal restaurant! Food was super fresh, simple, and the highest quality one could imagine. They also have FIVE DOLLAR GLASSES  OF WINE!!!! For this area, you'd expect an over priced menu, but that is not the case here. Enjoy before they become privy to the fact that they could double their prices to Eataly levels, and still be acceptable.
Amazing pie great location great staff
Hands down the best burrata cheese that I've had outside of Italy. Pizza crust was on point and delicious. Pizza sauce as it should be, tomatoes and salt.
The service was great. I got my pizza in 3 minutes. The pizza lacked ingredients and taste. The marinara sauce tasted fresh out of the can. Very disappointed!
They make there own fresh mozzarella everyday and flavored flavored stracciatella like pistachio and  truffle they have true  Neapolitan style pizzas using 00 flour outstanding
The absolute best pizza in Chicago, beautiful location and amazing staff.
One star because we cannot give it zero. Overpriced food that's not worth the cost.
Had the margherita and espresso, everything was delicious.

It is a cafe style setting with Michigan Ave. prices.  A couple of pizzas and a salad with tip will set you back $60+ (no drinks).  I agreed that they have a OK selection of beers and wines for a cafe and the staffs are definitely friendly and attentive.  Service was very fast, the pizzas were done before the Carprese.  The ingredients are fresh for sure, and the pizza dough is indeed the best at least for me because it is chewy.  It is not easy to find Neapolitan style pizza (thin crust) that is not on the harder and dry side.  But personally I think the pizzas are missing some flavors, I felt like eating a pizza salad with no dressing but that might be good for some people.  By no means I am one of those pizza dough dip in ranch typecof guy, but I think the pizza sauce needs a little more depth.  Comparatively speaking my recent visit to Pizzeria Portofino was quite different.  I will have to find a reason to come back here.
The vegetarian pizza is delicious!! So yummy.

(Translated by Google) The food is good and the staff is great. The price of a bottle of water ($ 7.00) and a small pastry ($ 5.00) are disproportionate  (Original) Il cibo è buono e il personale è ottimo. Il prezzo di una bottiglia di acqua ($ 7,00) e un piccolo pasticcino ($ 5,00) sono invece spropositati
The best pizza!!!

Went to try this new restaurant today. Waited more than 10 minutes for our server, who did not come to serve us, and another staff member had to step in to take our order instead.  We did not get any service from our server the entire time we were there. Instead, she spent 15 minutes talking to another table about her life story.  After we were done with our pizza, which was underwhelming, it took another 10 minutes for someone to notice that we were waiting for our check, then yet another staff member had to alert the owner that our server had not given us any attention or service.  The worst part was that the owner did not bother to apologize when giving us the bill, and even had us walk up to the cashier to pay for the bill. Not even a "Thank you" or a smile when we left.  This was definitely one of the worst experiences we've ever had and we will not be going back not recommending this place to anyone.
An Italian smart concept outlet bringing Neapolitan genuine cuisine experience in town👍🏼❤️
Service was fantastic. We has the Diobala pizza. It was good. The basil in it a little strong. A genuine Italian dish. The Neopolatin who owns it is super nice and hospitable.
Excellent pizza!!!!! It’s the best pizza we’ve ever had. I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a quick, great service and location.

This is an authentic Italian snack shop. They have the best Napolitan pizza. They have a good Italian wine and  beer selection. The staff is very polite service was very fast. The owners are very beautiful people they waited on me. This restaurant is perfect for the family.
Stunning location for this stateside flagship eatery! Love love love the feel of the place. Ask about their fresh homemade cheeses. A winner and a jewel in Chicago's downtown crown.
True Italy.. authentic tastes and pizza. Friendly, bistro atmosphere.
A most welcome addition to the area!  Deelish!
Ordered two calzones to go... very very very good.  This place is wonderful. Going back for sure.

It's only in its second day of operation but all indications are that the Mozzarella Store is definitely worth checking out if you find yourself in the area craving non-pasta Italian food, phenomenal espresso or if your looking for high-quality ingredients to make your own Italian dishes at home.  The mozzarella and burrattas are as fantastic as advertised, with a special shout out to the pizzaiolos who are not only efficient but make a seriously good neapolitan pizza comparable to ones I've had in Italy. The espresso I had was also absolutely fantastic and the caffeine options alone are worth the trip for anyone who considers themselves an Italian coffee connoisseur.  The 4/5 stars comes from a couple areas in which service can be improved (not bussing tables efficiently, mix ups and delays on non-pizza orders) and a couple questionable design choices (the menus, while cutely attached to pizza rollers, are cumbersome; there is no signage indicating where the bathroom/deli/espresso bar is), but at least the former should hopefully be resolved over time.  Overall worth checking out and looking forward to coming by more!

I live upstairs so wanted to try the new neighborhood addition. I was hesitant to leave a review on their first day open. I am in hopes that management will read it and make the changes necessary for it to survive in this neighborhood. The decor and ambiance are first rate. They really did make a huge investment. I wanted a place where I could get a quick cappuccino, slice of fresh pizza, a pannini, gellato,cup of soup with good bread. I don't want to spend $28 for a quick bite. I wanted a place that I could make a part of my daily routine. Some people don't want to deal with a hostess or waiter. The quality of food is excellent I just believe the business plan may not work for neighborhood regulars like myself.
Good fresh food and service and prices are fair for the location
